post.summary: Filters and returns a list of the contents for the given content_type.

parameters.name: permanent_link
parameters.description:
The permanent link for the requested +content_type+.
  Note: This parameter is part of the URL

parameters.name: filters[attribute]
parameters.description: The api-name of the attribute that will be used to filter the contents. As a special case it can have the value: +search+.

parameters.name: filters[values]
parameters.description:
This values are used when filtering a string/text attribute, the filter will return the
    contents that contain any of the values inside of the array

parameters.name: filters[min]
parameters.description:
The minimum value that the attribute must have in order to include that content in the list
    that will be returned

parameters.name: filters[max]
parameters.description:
The maximum value that the attribute must have in order to include that content in the
    list that will be returned

parameters.name: filters[exact_lat]
parameters.description: The exact latitude for the Radius filter

parameters.name: filters[exact_lng]
parameters.description: The exact longitude for the Radius filter

parameters.name: filters[radius]
parameters.description: The radius that will be used on a Radius Filter

parameters.name: filters[sw_lat]
parameters.description: The South west coordinate latitude for the Box Filter

parameters.name: filters[sw_lng]
parameters.description: The South west coordinate longitude for the Box Filter

parameters.name: filters[ne_lat]
parameters.description: The North east coordinate latitude for the Box Filter

parameters.name: filters[ne_lng]
parameters.description: The North east coordinate longitude for the Box Filter

parameters.name: filters[whole_word]
parameters.description: Only the contents that have one word equal to the term give will be returned. Default: false

parameters.name: filters[case_sensitive]
parameters.description: Forces the search to be case sensitive. Default: false

parameters.name: filters[search_method]
parameters.description: It can have one of the following values: +starts_with+, +ends_with+ or +whole_word.

parameters.name: minimal
parameters.description:
This will change the attributes that will be returned in the list.
If it is true, then only the attributes that are sent on the +filters+ array will be retrieved

parameters.name: brand_relative
parameters.description:
This is used to filter the contents by favorites, see Additional Filters.
If the value is true, it will activate the Favorite Filter

parameters.name: reference_module
parameters.description: The module that will be used to look for favorited contents in a +Favorite filter+

parameters.name: order_by[column]
parameters.description: The column/attribute that will be used to sort the returned contents

parameters.name: order_by[direction]
parameters.description: The direction of the sort, desc for descendant, asc for ascendant

parameters.name: order_by[random]
parameters.description: In case the sort is randomly done this parameter must be true

parameters.name: order_by[seed]
parameters.description: The seed used to randomize the sort, this needs to be consistent to allow the pagination to work

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items that will be returned in the request/page

404.description: If there are no content_types with the given permanent_link

401.description: If the content_type is not accessible for the mobile_user/device with the given access token

tags.name: v3base
tags.description:
Authentication¶ ↑

The API (V3) uses multiple levels of both authentication and authorization. Authentication is the process of
verifiying a user is who they say they are, whereas authorization verifies that the authorized user is able to
perform the action they are attempting. The later very much depends on user roles and permissions.

User Types¶ ↑

There are two distinct types of users on the platform, 'Platform Users' and 'Mobile Users'.  Generally speaking,
'Platform Users' are accounts which login to the platform's backend admin portal and are used for the management
of the platform, configuration, and reporting.  Inversely, 'Mobile Users' are the more predominant type of user
and are accounts which are used by the end-users of the platform-- namely patients/trial subjects, members of a patient's
Care Circle, PIs, Lab staff, and ancillary assistants.  All communication from mobile applications should being utilizing
'Mobile Users'.  Some advanced use-cases for custom, trial-specific backends/administration portals MAY utilize 'Platform Users', or both.

Mobile Application Key¶ ↑

The Mobile Application key is a hardcoded value in handset applications to confirm that the request is coming from
a P6-created/curated application. It is exchanged with the platform during :Device: creation.

Authentication Strategies¶ ↑

The platform supports a few distict authentication strategies, the main being 'user-token' and 'device-token'.

User Token (Available for: [Platform Users])¶ ↑

User Token consists of two credentials, both passed via the request HEADER: `X-User-Username` and `X-User-Token`.
The username is one of the following: The user's `email`, the user's `username`, or the user's `login`.
The token is the user's `authentication_token`. All these attributes are part of the standard `User` resource response
which is provided as the response to account creation and authentication endpoints.
Example cURL:
  curl -X "POST" "https://estudy.clinical6.com/v3/mobile_users/invitation"                  -H "X-User-Username: trodriguez@parallel6.com" -H "X-User-Token: yz7Tam8Tq1vu1CZzv_-c"

Device Token¶ ↑

Device tokens are available to all user types, but in practice are mainly only used for `Mobile User`s. The device token
depends on the creation and association of a `Device` to a specific account. Devices are transient credentials, in the sense
that you may (and MUST for some flows) generate a new device and associate it at any time.  (Most commonly via the Devices#create
and Registration#create endpoints). Each `Device` has an autogenerated field `access_token`, which MUST be supplied, via the
header as an 'Authorization Token'. The format for this is `Authorization: Token token=ACCESS_TOKEN`.

Example cURL:
  curl -X "POST" "https://sanofipompe.clinical6.com/v3/mobile_users/confirmation"                  -H 'Authorization: Token token=be33efdbace9b88c03b0339f6075eb38'

tags.description:
Allows for basic CRUD (and importing) of Mobile Users.

=== Load Mobile User resource scenario ===
Somehow, if we send a unexistent id in the URI path (ex. /mobile_users/0),

the load_resource doesn't throw an error like we expect (NotFound). In our tests, we expect to get an error code but it returns 200 and it continue as normal. Somehow the resource variable is filled in with what I think is the user logged into the system. Even if it's returning information, it's for the wrong user, so we're using our own load resource that forces the use of the ID from the params.

tags.name: v3relationshipsschedulerpersonalized_rule_schedules
tags.description:
This resource allows for the creation and retrieval of personalized versions of reminder rules and other scheduleable resources like eDiary__entry_groups or reminder__rules.

The values defined in the PersonalizedRuleSchedule will override any values defined in the schedulers for the given scheduleable. If the attribute is not defined for the PersonalizedRuleSchedule, the scheduler will use its default values.

Example:

Given the following values:
  personalized_rule_schedule.start_date = "2017-08-10"
  scheduleable.schedulers.first.time = "16:00"
  scheduleable.schedulers.first.start_date = "2017-08-01"
The final schedule will be
  start_date: "2017-08-10"
  time: "16:00"

Authorizable can be Section, DataCollection::FlowProcess and DynamicContent::ContentType.
AllowedAction persist the access symbol(ex: read, manage).
A permission grants access defined in associated allowed_actions
to the user role on records that fall under the authorizable association.

tags.name: v3relationshipsediaryentries
tags.description:
This resource tracks predefined and optional eDiary entries that are to be

completed on a specified date by a specific owner. Entries are either created automatically according to a schedule or they will be created on the spot when the user attempts to complete an optional survey. Entries are created directly from eDiary Entry Templates which will designate which flow_process needs to be completed for that entry. The entry also stores a reference to the values captured for that flow_process.

Load Mobile User resource scenario ===¶ ↑

Somehow, if we send a unexistent id in the URI path (ex. /mobile_users/0/entries..),

the load_resource doesn't throw an error like we expect (NotFound). In our tests, we expect to get an error code but it returns 200 and it continue as normal. Somehow the resource variable is filled in with what I think is the user logged into the system. Even if it's returning information, it's for the wrong user, so we're using our own load resource that forces the use of the ID from the params.

tags.name: apiadvertisements
tags.description:
The Advertisement are used to redirect the user to different screens and sections of the application. Usually the redirect to URLs An advertisement consist of: title: The title of the mobile_menu, this should be shown in the device image: The icon of the mobile_menu action: The action that the devices need to execute when the mobile menu is tapped action_object: Complementary information for the action, this value depends on the action.

This version of the Mobile Menus resource uses the actions as integers, the following list maps the values: no_action: 0 url: 1 places: 2 events: 3 galleries: 4 news: 5 arts: 6 brands: 7 rewards: 8 scavenger: 9 offers: 10 ar: 11 share: 12 information: 13 settings: 14 deals: 15 dealer_locator: 16 golf_tips: 17 fitting_tool: 18 shaft_standards: 19 outage_map: 20 cost_calculator: 21 payment_locator: 22 report_an_outage: 23 subcategory: 24

Action is the relevant event that was tracked (i.e: open, view, etc). Value is optional and is used to group the insights with more detail. The label is only used when value is present and this will be the label shown at the moment of analisis on the platform

tags.name: apiv2advertisements
tags.description:
The Advertisement are used to redirect the user to different screens and sections of the application. Usually the redirect to URLs An advertisement consist of: title: The title of the mobile_menu, this should be shown in the device image:

The icon of the mobile_menu

action:

The action that the devices need to execute when
the mobile menu is tapped

action_object: Complementary information for the action, this value depends on the action.

tags.name: apiv2agreements
tags.description: Agreements is a resource that allows getting electronic signature on pre-prepared document template using Adobe Sign web service. This resource needs an agreement_template_id, recipients and provides methods to request a signature from the user by dynamically creating the agreement and presenting the user with the customized URL allowing him to enter the requested fields and to sign the agreement.

tags.name: apiv2data_collectioncaptured_values
tags.description: captured values can be retrieved and viewed by Mobile users. A captured value comes from the FlowProcess#collect endpoint. A captured value can be related to data for the mobile user, profile, site, etc. A captured value will be related to a captured value group. A captured value group is directly related to Mobile user's submittal date. Multiple captured values can be submitted for a single input. The latest captured value will be displayed.

tags.name: apiv2data_collectionflow_processes
tags.description:
Defines a flow process or a sequence of screens that are displayed to the user in order to capture data. To edit, delete, or create a new flow process go to /data_collection/flow_processes. To create a new flow process step or screen type, go to /admin/content_types and enable the as Flow Process step flag. Every new CMS module that you create with that flag represents a different type of screen that the user can use/customize.

Possible Question Types with their styles:

single_choice:
  radio_buttons
  dropdown
  slider
multiple_choice
  radio_buttons
  dropdown
input:
  text_area
  text
numeric:
  text_box
  range

tags.name: apiv2data_collectioncontainers
tags.description: Defines a container object or a categorization of flow_processes which includes the position of that flow process within the container. To view a list of flow_processes sorted by position per container go to /data_collection/containers/:id where the id is the container permanent_link.

tags.name: apiv2data_collectionlinked_step_comments
tags.description: Renders a collection of comments given a flow process and a linked step.

tags.name: apiv2data_collectioncaptured_value_groups
tags.description:
Represents a capture of data submitted during a FlowProcess This can be created by a MobileUser, a Site or a Study

Use the submited_at attribute to determine when the user answered the flow instead of the created_at

tags.name: apiv2reminderrules
tags.description:
Defines the schedule and additional details that each kind

of Reminder should have. The rules can be redefined by personal rules per mobile user

tags.name: apiv2dynamic_contents
tags.description:
This is the main resource that the mobile application will use. The dynamic contents are grouped by their content_type

Content Type¶ ↑

A content type represents a group of contents that share the same attributes.Contents that belong to different content_types can have different attributes and different behaviours.The content_type has a permanent_link that identifies content_type uniquely, the permanent_link is the key to retrieve contents of a certain content_type.

tags.name: apiv2mobile_menus
tags.description: The mobile menus are used to redirect the user to different screens and sections of the application. A mobile menu consist of: title: The title of the mobile_menu, this should be shown in the device image: The icon of the mobile_menu action: The action that the devices need to execute when the mobile menu is tapped action_object: Complementary information for the action, this value depends on the action (Deprecated).

tags.name: apilog
tags.description:
This is a debugging tool that tracks error or debugging messages.

Most of the fields are optional and should be used only as guidelines, however depending on the amount of information tracked it can be easier to find certain bugs.

The only required field is the Level.

tags.name: apiusers
tags.description: Identifies the user inside the platform allowing the likes, favorites, profile and other functionality to be saved

tags.name: apidynamic_contents
tags.description:
This is the main resource that the mobile application will use. The dynamic contents are grouped by their content_type

Content Type¶ ↑

A content type represents a group of contents that share the same attributes. Contents that belong to different content_types can have different attributes and different behaviours. The content_type has a permanent_link that identifies a content_type uniquely, the permanent_link is the key to retrieve contents of a certain content_type.

tags.name: apistatus
tags.description: Tracks the status of objects in association to their owner. The object whose status will be tracked can belong to any of the STATUSABLE_TYPES. The owner for whom the status is tracked can be any of the OWNER TYPES.
